result.execSummary:
The defendant Cierra N. Bernarde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Follow any rules and counseling determined by agent.
No contact with victim.

11:06 AM Defendant Cierra N. Bernarde in court with attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge.  Bela Alexander Ballo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Stockbridge requests this motion hearing be adjourned. She has not been able to meet with the defendant, defendant had missed meeting because she did not have a ride.  Atty Ballo makes rebuttle, he opposes adjournment, this has been rescheduled many times.  Judge allows one last adjournment.
Motion hearing on June 13, 2019 at 11:00 am.

11:17 AM Attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge in court.  Bela Alexander Ballo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in a resident treatment program.  Defense counsel will provide proof to the State.  ADA Ballo requests a $3,000 warrant, but is willing to stay until Wednesday.  Court takes a short recess at 11:19 AM as defendant has walked in and counsel wishes to speak to her.  Reconvene at 11:20 AM.  Court vacates the warrant request.  Remarks by Atty. Stockbridge and requests an adjournment for new motion and sentencing date.  So granted.  Bond remains in effect.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 13, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on April 5, 2019 at 11:15 am.

Status conference on January 14, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Atty Stockbridge represents defendant.  Atty Haase will fill in today.  Requesting reduction from $500 cash to a signature bond.  Both attorneys make arguments.  Judge will reduce the bond to $250 cash. 
Atty Stockbridge will need to schedule next activity with DA office and Judicial Assistant.

Defendant present in custody with Attny Elisabeth Stockbridge.  State appears by Alec Ballo.  There is a motion to revoke the deferred prosecution agreement because defendant hasn't completed her community service and did complete her DV counseling but late.  Attny Stockbridge will provide the DA with some additional information to determine if they still want to revoke.  As defendant is in jail because of this matter she would like a bond modification hearing.  DA Ballo indicates victim would have to be notified first.

Defendant Cierra N. Bernarde in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Defendant Cierra N. Bernarde in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court received confidential fax and questions parties as to release.  Atty Streicher aware of document and DE will authorize release of information.  Dep. SR sworn & testifies. Witness id's DE.  Exhibit 1 marked & id'd.  ADA Niemi moves to admit Exhibit 1.  No objection, Court admits. Cross-exam.  Dep. SB sworn & testifies.  Ex. 2 marked & id'd.  ADA Niemi moves to admit Ex. 2, no objections, Court admits.  No cross exam.  ADA Niemi offers Exhibit 3 for Judicial Notice, no objection, Court accepts.  Closing statements.  Court finds probablecase has been met and binds the matter over for trial.  Atty Streicher moves for immediate arraignment.  ADA Niemi -information will mirror complaint.  Atty Streicher waives reading, enters NG pleas and request PTC.  
BOND MODIFICATION MOTION
Atty Streicher argues for signature bond or cash bond not to exceed $1000.ADA Niemi makes statement.  Court grants modification, amends bond to $5000 signature bond w/originalconditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 10:45 am.
